data.task: Add multiplayer sync and proximity voice

data.root_cause: MultiplayerManager referenced non-existent sprite key warrior-iso-v3
data.fix: Changed sprite key to player to match Boot.ts preloader

data.task: Debug sprite morphing and floating issues
data.objective: Fix sprite changes during movement and floating sprites

data.root_cause: MultiplayerManager spawning remote players with generic player sprite instead of warrior animations, causing texture switching when local player moves
data.fix: Update spawnRemotePlayer to use warrior-south-0 as base sprite

data.root_cause: Sprite origin set to (0.5, 0.5) causing feet to be centered vertically instead of anchored at base
data.fix: Adjust sprite origin to (0.5, 0.85) to anchor feet to ground

changes: Fixed sprite morphing by using warrior-south-0 instead of player sprite in MultiplayerManager
Fixed floating sprites by adjusting origin from (0.5,0.5) to (0.5,0.85)
Applied fixes to player, NPCs, and remote multiplayer sprites
data.verification: Screenshot shows sprites properly anchored to ground with feet touching tiles

data.root_cause: Visual Y offset not applied when sprite elevation changes - sprite stays at logical Y position instead of rendering lower to account for platform depth
data.fix: Update DepthManager.setIsoData to adjust sprite visual Y position by -elevation*depth_per_level
Elevation offset corrected from 40px to 20px per level
data.reasoning: Tiles render at -20px per elevation (MapGenerator.toIso), sprites were using -40px causing hover effect
data.verification_needed: User should test walking onto yellow/gold platform (elevation 3) to confirm proper anchoring

data.task: Improve tile rendering to match FFT style
requirements: Add visible grid borders between tiles

data.issue: Players see different positions for each other
data.approach: Test with multiple browser instances, check server state broadcast, verify position interpolation

data.server: Uses simple velocity (150) with time delta
data.fix: Simplify both to use direct velocity without acceleration OR make server simulate Phaser physics

changes: Client now sends actual position along with input
Server uses client position directly instead of simulating
Eliminates physics mismatch between client acceleration and server velocity
data.testing: Manual testing required with 2 browser windows

data.approach: Build automated test with video capture to verify fix before delivery
data.required: Must confirm working before showing to user
